an7.37:4.1: “Mendicants, when a friend has seven qualities you should frequent, accompany, and attend them, even if they tell you to go away.
an7.37:4.3: They’re likable, agreeable, respected, and admired. They admonish you and they accept admonishment. They speak on deep matters. And they don’t urge you to do bad things.
an7.37:4.4: When a friend has these seven qualities you should frequent, accompany, and attend with them, even if they tell you to go away.”
an7.37:5.4: and doesn’t urge you to do bad.
an7.37:6.2: these things are found is your friend.
an7.37:6.3: If you want to have a friend,
an7.37:6.5: you should keep company with such a person,
an7.37:6.6: even if they send you away.”
